author: Staff Reporter
text:
Two houses in Alanganatham Village were damaged on Friday following a clash between youth belonging to two communities during New Year revelry. Ten persons were arrested.

The police said that when members of one community burst firecrackers near Mariamman Temple in the village, the members of another community asked them not to do so. This led to an argument between the youth and it soon turned into clash.

Both the group exchanged blows and the houses belonging to Ramesh and Jeganathan and a two-wheeler were damaged. The police arrived at the spot and brought the situation under control.

Case registered

Based on a complaint, Erumapatty police registered a case under Sections 147 (rioting), 323 (voluntarily causing hurt), 294b (uttering obscene in public places) of IPC r/w Section 3 of Tamil Nadu Public Property Prevention of Damage and Loss Act, 1992 and Section 3 (1) (x) of The Scheduled Castes and The Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities), Act, 1989. Ten youths were arrested and lodged at prison.

Police picketing have been posted in the village to prevent any untoward incident.
title: New Year revelry: 10 arrested for group clash in Namakkal
